DataElement.preferredName: Ex Vivo Manipulation Without Erythrocyte Remove Or Volume Reduced Graft Occurrence Yes No Character Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not ex vivo graft manipulation other than for RBC removal or volume reduction occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ex Vivo Manipulation Without Erythrocyte Remove Or Volume Reduced Graft Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._Cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm and little else; biconcave, anucleate discs, 7nm diameter in mammals._Shift the position or location of; take out of._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._Made less in size or amount or degree._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: ex vivo Manipulation Without Erythrocyte Remove Or Volume Reduced Transplant
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.:Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine):Red blood cells. Mature erythrocytes are non-nucleated, biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.:No Value Exists:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.:Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: Outside the living body; referring to the use or positioning of an organ, tissue, or cell in an environment outside the living organism while the tissue or cells remain viable.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.
Shift the position or location of; take out of.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
Made less in size or amount or degree.
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: . Updated def for "graft". No version needed.  AK 10/4/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
